text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!

I just wanted to make a video because today
I’m gonna be making
DIY Smart Cookie Magnets.

I’m gonna make them to look like the Nerdy
Nummies Logo, a few years ago I made

Keyboard Magnets using the keys from a keyboard,
it was really fun because I

could write little messages for my roommates
and hang your grocery list.

And, I’ve been meaning to do a craft project
with polymer clay, I really like

working with polymer clay because it’s similar
to baking.

After you’ve made your shape, whether its
a little pendant or earring, or a

little sculpture, you bake it. It’s just
not edible!

So today we’re gonna be making DIY Smart
Cookie Magnets!

The things you will need, will be: Polymer
Clay, the colors that you’re gonna

need are black, brown, white, tan, and light
pink. I found these at the craft

store at Michael’s and they are by the brand
Craft Smart.

You will also need some super glue, some super
strong, small magnets,

a toothbrush, fondant molding tools, an X-ACTO
knife, 2 small paint brushes,

a fondant rolling pin, 2 small oval cookie
cutters, 1 is 1” and the other is 3/4”.

And we’re gonna need chalk, colors brown
and yellow, and last but not least,
we’re gonna need some gloss varnish.

The first thing that we’re gonna do is open
our tan polymer clay, and cut it
in half using our X-ACTO knife.

This isn’t food Cookie, you don’t want
any of this!

The reason I’m doing this is because each
of the little packets of clay

that I got are 2 ounces. And, I want each
cookie magnet to be 1 ounce.

I’m gonna set 1 of these off to the side
right here, and I’m gonna start

working the clay with my hands, this is called
conditioning, and it’s just because
the clay’s pretty tough.

After you’ve worked your clay, now we’re
gonna roll it into a ball, and I’m

gonna do the same thing with my other tan
piece of clay.

And then I’m gonna do the exact same thing
to all of our other polymer clay colors.

I wanted to make 4 cookie magnets, so I took
2 packets of the clay, cut them both

in 1/2, I’ve rolled 4 balls and I’m gonna
show you how to shape the first one.

Using your hand, I’m just using my palm,
I’m just flattening it down,

you’re just gonna keep working it until
it’s about 2” wide, boom!

And, there we go, it’s already starting
to look like a cookie.

This is kind of like what my sugar cookies look
like after I’ve baked them.

I flattened it our to be a little less than
1/2 an inch thick, and, it’s about
2 inches in diameter.

We’ve shaped all of our tan clay, I want
them to look a little bit more like a

cookie and have a little bit more texture,
so you’re gonna take a toothbrush,

and you’re just gonna press, boop-boop-boop!
All the way around, just keep doing this!

And it will make it look kind of like a sugar
cookie.

And make sure to use a new toothbrush, you
don’t want to use your toothbrush,
because clay is not edible.
Use your sister’s instead!

Cookie, mwuh-mwuh-muwh-muwh, oh that’s a
good… Oh my-my-my-my good girl!

Just finished adding texture and now we’re
gonna add a little bit of color.

Over here I’ve got my tray with my 2 chalk
colors, brown and yellow.

You’re gonna take your X-ACTO knife and
we’re gonna shave off some of our chalk.

This is what our little chalk dust
should look like. And, this is so fun,
I feel kind of like a beauty guru, like, hmm-hmm-hmm!

At the very bottom of the cookie, I’m gonna
shave a little bit of brown chalk,
so that it looks like a baked cookie.

Now we’re going to combine our color palate,
I’m gonna take a little bit of

brown, and a little bit of yellow, and I’m
gonna mix it around, just blend these
2 together. I like, feel like Bob Ross today!

Then I’m just gonna brush right here, all
along the edges for a nice golden brown.

Lastly, we’re gonna take a little bit of
yellow, just do a few strokes, to blend it.

The next thing that we’re gonna make are
the Nerdy Nummies eyeballs and glasses.

Using our fondant roller, I’m gonna roll
out our white and black clay.

I’m taking the bigger oval, and I’m gonna
cut out 2 for each cookie.

Then, take the same, larger oval cookie cutter,
and we’re gonna cut out again,

8 of these. They’re not quite done yet,
we’re gonna cut out the center to look like

glasses, you’re gonna take the smaller oval
cookie cutter, and just do a
second cut, right inside.

We’ve got the rims of our glasses cut out
over here, and now I’m gonna take this

fondant tool, it’s a ball tool, it has a
little ball at the end, and I’m just gonna

use it by applying a little bit of pressure,
being really gentle, on the

outside of the rim and the inside of the oval,
to make our glasses frames

nice and smooth. All of our little clay frames
are ready, and now I’m gonna
start putting them on our eyeballs.

I’m just gonna pick ‘em up 1 at a time,
I’m using a little tool to help me.

Then, I’m just gonna place him on top of
our white eyeballs.

Using our other clay colors, I’ve rolled
a really thin little snake of the pink,

black and white clay. Using our exact-o knife
we’re gonna cut 2 larger pieces,

then I’m gonna roll them into a ball. Using
my thumb, I’m just gonna flatten ‘em.

Then I’m gonna pick ‘em up, and bring
‘em over here.

Then we’re gonna cut out 2 very small pieces
of white and then we’re gonna roll ‘em.

Gonna pick ‘em up, place ‘em on top of
the little black eyeball.
Now I’m gonna cut out some cute little cheeks.
Cheeks-cheeks-cheeks-cheeks-cheeks!
She’s over it!

Same thing, I’m just gonna cut out a little
bit of our pink snake.

Roll the pink clay into a ball and flatten
out. Then we’re gonna place them
on top, right at the edge.
Time to start assembly!

We’re gonna take 1 of these little guys,
we’re gonna place it onto the cookie….

So cute! And starting to look like a little
smart cookie!

We’re gonna keep adding some details, I’m
gonna cut 2 small pieces,

roll them into balls, and smoosh ‘em, and
put them on the end of the glass frame.

Then we’re gonna cut another piece of black,
roll it a little bit thinner,

and place him on top to connect
our glasses.

Last black clay detail for decoration is going
to be the smiley face.

So we’re going to cut 1 last piece, roll
it out a little bit, and then into a smile!
Gonna pick him up, place him on the cookie.

Final decoration step, we are gonna be using
our brown clay to make little mini

chocolate chips. As most of you know, the
Nerdy Nummies cookie has 6 chocolate chips.
There’s 4 on the top and 2 on the bottom.
Down here I’ve rolled out our brown clay, into a small little snake, and then taking our X-ACTO knife,

I'm gonna cut little even measurements, then
we’re gonna roll all of our

little cuts into balls, once you’ve rolled
them into balls, we are gonna mold

them into little chocolate chips, you’re
gonna use your thumb and your pointer

finger, and you’re just gonna kind of pinch
and twist. There we go!

Now that we’ve got 6, we are gonna stick them
onto your cookie.

You’re gonna take the little ball tool,
you’re gonna add a little bit of pressure,

making a cavity, and then place the chocolate
chip on top.

We finished 1 of our cookies, and now I’m
gonna decorate the 3 over here to make

them match. Once your clay cookies are assembled,
it is time to bake them.

I have placed these onto a baking sheet, lined
with a piece of parchment paper

so that they won’t stick while they’re
baking.

You’re gonna heat your oven to 275 degrees
and bake for about 15 minutes.

Once your clay cookies have baked, we’ve
given them plenty of time to cool,

you don’t want to add the magnets or the
gloss while they’re warm, you just want

them to be room temperature! To assemble our
magnet, it’s very easy, I’m just

gonna take a cookie, flip it over onto the
back side, take a little bit

of super glue, just be careful, because superglue
is super sticky!

And someone may have glued their fingers together
before in the past!
Then take 1 of your magnets, and place him on there.
A-doo-doo-doo! Belly rubs! Belly rubs!

We’ve got all of our magnets on the back,
and gave them plenty of time to set,

And now, I am going to do the last step, this
is totally optional, but,

I am going to be painting a very thin layer
of gloss varnish all over the top

of my magnet so that it has a very smooth
and polished look and feel to it.

I’m taking the second paintbrush, dipping
it into the gloss.

And then, I’m just gonna paint on a thin layer,
all over the cookie.
Would you like a cookie? Just kidding!
They’re not edible, these are magnets!
Ta-da!

Here are the DIY Smart Cookie Magnets that
we made today, I am really excited to

have new, adorable magnets for my fridge,
to hold grocery lists, and

fun little photos. I also really enjoyed this
craft project and working with

polymer clay because, it reminds me of baking.
You mold your little shapes and then

you bake ‘em in the oven, and then they’re
done!

I’ll be taking lots of pictures of these
cute little magnets and posting them on
Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Tumblr.

And if you guys make some Smart Cookie Magnets,
please take a picture and send
it to me, I love seeing all of your creations!

Thanks for watching, I hope you enjoyed this
DIY, and if you have any other

ideas for any other DIYs that you would like
to see, please let me know,
leave me a comment down below.
Alright, bye-bye!
